itemLabel: Ruth Lister, Baroness Lister of Burtersett

wikipedia_page.main: Margot Ruth Aline Lister, Baroness Lister of Burtersett,  (born 3 May 1949), is currently Professor of Social Policy at Loughborough University. She has written or contributed to a number of books, pamphlets and articles on poverty, social security and women's citizenship.

response: Hunt has recently turned his attention to social rights in the UK. In 2014–15, he sat on the statutory human rights inquiry into emergency health care established by the Northern Ireland Human Rights Commission.Human rights inquiry: emergency health care, Northern Ireland Human Rights Commission, 2015.  He has joined the Board of the National Health Service (NHS) England initiative, Sexual and Reproductive Health Rights, Inclusion and Empowerment (SHRINE). He has been appointed a Patron of Just Fair, a London-based think-tank on economic and social rights. With Ruth Lister, Baroness Lister of Burtersett he has written for the think-tank, Compass, on social rights in the UK.Ruth Lister and Paul Hunt, To combat right-wing populism, we need to reclaim human rights, 12 December 2016. In 2017 the Centre for Welfare Reform published Hunt's Social Rights are Human Rights - but the UK System is Rigged. https://www.centreforwelfarereform.org/uploads/attachment/584/social-rights-are-human-rights.pdf  In 2018, Hunt was appointed by Nicola Sturgeon, First Minister of Scotland, to her Advisory Group on Human Rights Leadership. The Advisory Group is due to report in December 2018.
